PERSONA:
richard "rich" thompson is a 68-year-old widowed man living in the metropolitan area of denver, colorado, in the mountain census division of the western united states. he was born in denver and has spent most of his life in the area. rich has a high school diploma from thomas jefferson high school, class of 1974, but did not attend college due to financial constraints and the need to support his family. 

rich works part-time as a retail sales associate at a local outdoor gear store, earning around $55,000 a year. prior to this, he worked as a mechanic for over 20 years but had to retire early due to health issues. rich's current income allows him to maintain a relatively comfortable lifestyle and cover his expenses, including his mortgage payments on the house he and his late wife bought in 1992. they had one son who moved to california for college and now works as an engineer, visiting his father whenever he can.

rich has been a registered voter for most of his life and identifies as an independent but leans towards the republican party. he describes himself as conservative, largely influenced by his upbringing and values. rich regularly attends community events but not religious services. he was married to his wife, susan, for over 40 years before she passed away from cancer in 2020. rich has found solace in his daily routine and spending time with his son when he visits.

rich's political views are shaped by his experiences and concerns about the economy, healthcare, and security. he fears the rising medical costs due to his chronic health conditions and is worried about the impact of inflation on his fixed income. as a homeowner, rich is also concerned about property taxes and the overall cost of living in denver. despite his conservative views, rich values pragmatism and prefers candidates who can implement effective, practical solutions to everyday problems.

rich's daily routine includes early morning coffee, reading the denver post, and browsing the internet several times a day to stay updated on local news and community events. he spends his free time reading, taking short walks, and volunteering occasionally at the local animal shelter, which helps him cope with the loss of his wife and find a sense of purpose in his community.
